info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:23PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Garfield County through 400 PM MDT... At 322 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northwest of De Beque, or 34 miles north of Grand Junction, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Garfield County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
